reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: PROGRAMME NATIONAL INTEGRE LEPRE ET TUBERCULOSE

description.narrative: Burundi is a country of an estimated 10.1 million inhabitants in a 27,830 square-kilometre territory. Tuberculosis (TB) incidence (all forms) has more than halved between 2000 (288 per 100,000) and 2014 (126 per 100,000).(WHO). However, case detection is low (53%, all forms), and the estimated prevalence of tuberculosis (including HIV-positive TB patients) is 195 per 100,000 (WHO, 2014). The estimated burden of multidrug-resistent (MDR)-TB is 2.2% among new TB cases, and 11% among retreatment cases, and HIV prevalence among TB patients is 15%. This grant focuses on increasing case detection and treatment of TB and multidrug-resistant (MDR)-TB during the period of 2015-2017. Strategies include the increased access and use of new TB diagnostic techniques such as GeneExperts, the cooperation between the PNLT and theNational AIDS Control Program (PNLS) for improved care among co-infected patients, improved case management in the community and the continuation of the MDR-TB program. The interventions are aligned with the country’s National Strategic Plan for TB (2014-2020), as well the joint TB-HIV action plan for the period 2015-2017. The National Integrated Leprosy and Tuberculosis Control Programme (PNILT) has been the Principal Recipient for TB grants under Round 4, Round 7 and the Transitional Funding Mechanism (TFM), with satisfactory programmatic performance ratings.

title.narrative: Number of children <5 in contact with TB patients who began isonizide preventive therapy

Percentage of laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance for smear microscopy among the total number of laboratories that undertake smear microscopy during the reporting period
DOTS-other 1: Percentage of TB testing and treatment centers (TTC) without stock-outs (one week or more) of firstline TB drugs during the reporting period
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Percentage of previously treated TB patients receiving DST (bacteriologically positive cases only)
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
Percentage of bacteriologically confirmed TB cases successfully treated (cured plus completed treatment) among the bacteriologically confirmed TB cases registered during a specified period
Number of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed TB, new and relapses
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
DOTS-other 2: Number and percentage of TB (all forms) among children (notified and projected), among all notified cases (all forms, adults and children)
Percentage of HIV-positive registered TB patients given anti-retroviral therapy during TB treatment
Percentage of TB patients who had an HIV test result recorded in the TB register
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Percentage of new HIV-positive patients starting IPT during the reporting period
Percentage of HIV-positive patients who were screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings
